A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: It was well-made and not awful but there were a lot of plot holes and for such a long run time it felt rushed\, as if I was watching two movies that had been spliced together. The compression of the timeline messed with the characterization and a lot of the actions characters took seemed forced\, like the writers were just trying to accommodate the plot. I wasn't a huge fan of TFA either\, but I liked it more than this\, if only because it felt more well-paced and well-written and it had heart throughout\, whereas this didn't really connect with me emotionally until the very end. All in all\, it's pretty mediocre. I appreciated that there was an attempt to take risks and be original\, but a lot of the plot also felt recycled from the original trilogy. Rogue One has still been my favorite of the new Star Wars films so far.
